answers.answer: Your fasting glucose numbers are running high. Your feet hurting and burning and tingleing sound like diabetic neuropathy. You need to get a diagnoses and get stared on medication if you are diabetic. or nutritional councelling if you are pre-diabetic. Please see your doctor.

question: Good morning, Of late (past 6 months) when having blood work done for my thyroid problems, my glucose reading under Basic metabolic panel, has been elvated. The last three readings were 111, 121, 120.  Normal range was 70-110.  I fasted with these tests.   Of late, my feet have changed in shape and the top of my feet look big where it is hard to put on shoes.  Also, of late, my feet hurt, burn and tingle and now I am wondering if I have diabetic neuopathy with the glucose numbers I just posted.   I am thinking of signing up with Diabetes of America as the6 have opened up several branches in this city.  Have you heard of them and are they good?  I am also wondering if I have metabolic syndrome.Thanks so much.
title: Feet Pain
